title: I refreshed firefox about a year ago. I cannot open old bookmarks now. Even when I click on "old firefox data" on desktop it never opens
content:
I pressed the firefox refresh button a year ago. It said none of my bookmarks would be lost. Ive tried countless methods to open these previous bookmarks. Nothing works. I've been given several solutions which all involve complex and many sequences. I am not tech savvy at all. Is there not a simple method to open up old bookmarks by inserting the title somewhere  ?? I have windows 7 and there is on my desktop an icon saying "old firefox data".

Thankyou Philip
creator: philipgperry

title: Firefox freezes PC permanently at unpredictable times, forcing me to force-restart pc
content:
This problem appears to have been around for years. However, I have never experienced it. I installed Firefox 105.0.1 (64-bit) on 2022-09-24 and since then I have been experiencing it. The PC freezes and the only solution is a reset. When I check the logs I find: Warnings like this: The Desktop Window Manager process has exited. (Process exit code: 0xe0464645, Restart count: 4, Primary display device ID: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1080)

Errors like this: Faulting application name: dwm.exe, version: 10.0.19041.746, time stamp: 0x6be51595 Faulting module name: KERNELBASE.dll, version: 10.0.19041.1949, time stamp: 0xcb12e58e Exception code: 0xe0464645 Fault offset: 0x000000000010fb62 Faulting process ID: 0x3ec Faulting application start time: 0x01d8d750b416ff93 Faulting application path: C:\WINDOWS\system32\dwm.exe Faulting module path: C:\WINDOWS\System32\KERNELBASE.dll Report ID: 4327992c-3041-41e6-b68a-127d0cf53bc8 Faulting package full name: Faulting package-relative application ID:

A couple of days ago I installed version 105.0 (64-bit) and the problem hasn't occurred yet.

So, I conclude the problem is with version 105.1.
creator: paulo.j.f.martins

title: Logging in to support.discord.com using zendesk doesn't work.
content:
When attempting to log into support.discord.com, I can't click sign in, as a cookie is blocking me. Discord have told me as it's a specific problem with Firefox, I needed to ask, it also appears to be something that I've setup in Firefox, as a fresh install worked fine.

In the popup for logging in, I get a banner message stating: "Cookies required to use Firefox

To continue signing in using Firefox, allow cookies to be stored on this device. You might see this screen more than once. " with a continue hyperlink at the bottom. This generates a popup asking me to accept a cookie. I accepted this, but it's still blocking me from logging in. I have tried disabling my extensions that might block the cookie, and they have also allowed the cookie that was requested.

On a brand new browser, it's fine. I have strict blocking enabled, with ublock and duckduckgo's extension (all were disabled when I was testing if they were blocking it) and I still can't log in. I'm not sure what else is being blocked (other than google analytics, but that shouldn't stop me logging in).

I do also get some console errors: Uncaught ReferenceError: $ is not defined

title: Remove publisher Atlantic or allow alternates
content:
Hello, this is more a change request for additional functionality than a problem, if there's a better place to post this please suggest it. This applies to Firefox (for PC) as well as for Android, may also apply to other versions w the same feature but I do not use those flavors so cannot verify.

My request is to be able to remove or change site vendors of the story suggestions in my home page; several publishers are fine for me but a few are ones I will either not read due to personal objections to their content or practices, or are simply not interesting. I wish to be able to customize the sources of these suggestions, but specifically block some publishers such as the Atlantic.

Thank you Mozilla and the Firefox team! Long time user and fan, Bryce

creator: frank_drv

title: Barra de direcciones inservible por llenarse de iconos inútiles
content:
Hola.

Como indico en el titulo, Firefox ha convertido mi barra de direcciones en algo absolutamente inútil al llenarla de iconos redundantes pues los que me interesan los tengo en la barra de herramientas (que para eso es), en color, que es como se distinguen bien y rápido (la naturaleza nos dio visión en color por algo, amigos diseñadores de IU de Mozilla que se empeñan en obligarnos a practicar el daltonismo). Lo peor es el letrero «Contenedor temporal X» con los iconos correspondientes al principio y al final; como se ve en el pantallazo que adjunto, se come fácilmente el 60% del espacio disponible en una barra con una anchura de 500 px, pero los otros también molestan bastante y entre todos es imposible ver o copiar/modificar la dirección de la página en que está uno. ¿Hay forma de quitar todos esos iconos, auqnue tenga que ir de uno en uno?

Gracias y saludos.
creator: Torrijas

title: Audio stops when monitor turns off and on
content:
So this problem is isolated with Firefox as it doesn't happen with Edge or VLC on this pc. If I have Twitch or Youtube, probably any other audio or video playing, open when I turn the monitor off the audio will no longer go through properly when it is turned back on. The video is still playing fine but the audio isn't going through properly. Refreshing the page fixes the issue.

I have made sure to disable all other audio outputs and defaulted the current HDMI output. Audio playback works fine on every other application that I have tried.

Running Windows 11.

title: Impostazioni firefox
content: Buongiorno, avendo installato ubuntu 22.04 sul mio computer ho avuto in tutte le versioni di ubuntu precedentemente installate il problema dello scorrimento invertito della rorellina del mio mouse che ho sempre risolto impostando una chiave di default da about:config di firefox. Fin qui tutto ok tutto funziona regolarmente fin quando non mi accorgo di una anomalia che prima non avevo ed è questa: anche impostando la chiave contenuta in about:config avendo impostato di default come browser predefinito firefox sul mio sistema, quando si accede a firefox cliccando su un link esterno, e di conseguenza richiamando l'apertura di firefox in automatico, questo non tiene piu conto delle impostazioni di default precedentemente settate su about:config e quindi mi si ripresenta lo scorrimento del mouse al contrario. Se chiudo firefox e poi lo riapro invece è tutto ok. Spero di essere stato abbastanza chiaro nella spegazione dell'anomalia. Buona Gionata e Grazie.

title: Is it possible to recover the entirety of my data linked to my Firefox profile in my online Firefox account?
content:
Hello :) I know the subject might sound a bit vague so I will try to be more specific in the following.

Unfortunately, I have recently lost the full content of my Firefox profile that is usually recorded in the Application Support folder on a Mac

I had a lot of pages and tabs opened at that time and I would really like to recover all of these data if possible.

Since I cannot access to my sessionstore/recovery/bookmarks/prefs files (etc.) anymore, I would like to know if Firefox would be able to recover theses files in its database provided I had a connected Firefox account to it when it happened? If so, could you please explain me where I could find these data on my account?

Besides, could you think of another way to get to the same result knowing that I don't have a recent clone/time machine backup unfortunately?

Many thanks for your potential help!
creator: prvt.mailing

title: importing passwords firefox 105.0.1
content:
Hello, 

 I was having problems with one of my passwords not updating correctly in firefox 105.0.1   I exported all of the passwords into a csv file and then followed the steps outlined here in the forum to turn on import passwords from a file.  Then while trying to fix the password problem I removed all passwords/ids.  I clicked on the import from a file, selected the file I exported to but nothing happens.. No passwords, no id's. I thought maybe I wouldn't see it in the about:logins screen, so  I tested out three different sites from the export file and no luck on anything.  I was expecting a box to pop up telling me the import was successful or if I was sure I wanted to import all of these passwords but nothing, so even though I get the drop down to import I can't.  Has anyone experienced this problem before or any solutions.

Thanks in advance
creator: mlorkowski
